articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A gunman crossing from Jordan killed three Israeli civilians at the Allenby Bridge border in the occupied West Bank before security forces shot him dead on Sunday, Israeli authorities said.
articles.title: Gunman crossing from Jordan kills three Israelis at border, Israeli army says

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike on a house in Jabalia on Sunday killed Mohammad Morsi, deputy director of the Gaza Civil Emergency Service in the northern areas of the Gaza Strip, and four of his family, health officials said.
articles.title: Israeli strike kills senior rescue service official in Gaza as fighting rages

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia said on Sunday that its forces had taken full control of a town in eastern Ukraine as Moscow's forces advance on the strategically important city of Pokrovsk and seek to pierce the Ukrainian defensive front lines.
articles.title: Russia takes Ukrainian town in advance on Pokrovsk

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Typhoon Yagi and the landslides and floods it triggered have killed at least 24 people and injured another 299 in northern Vietnam on the weekend, the government said, as authorities on Monday warned of more flooding.
articles.title: Vietnam's death toll from Typhoon Yagi rises to 24, govt says

articles.author: Joseph Ax, Rich McKay, Gabriella Borter
articles.description: The search resumed with the help of numerous law enforcement agencies, including a drone equipped with infrared technology.
articles.title: Kentucky highway shooting suspect still at large as manhunt paused overnight

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China called on the Philippines to "seriously consider the future" of a relationship "at a crossroads" in a Monday commentary published by the People's Daily, the newspaper of the governing Communist Party, amid tensions in the South China Sea.
articles.title: China says ties with Philippines at a crossroads over South China Sea

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr said on Monday that evangelist preacher Apollo Quiboloy will not be given special treatment following his arrest on Sunday, after a weeks-long police search for the celebrity pastor.
articles.title: No special treatment for celebrity pastor Apollo Quiboloy, says Philippine president

articles.author: Joe Cash
articles.description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez is expected to meet Chinese President Xi Jinping on Monday, with the EU and China on the verge of a trade war and Beijing preparing to hit back at Spanish automobiles and pork if Brussels imposes tariffs on its EVs.
articles.title: Spanish autos, pork in Beijing's sights with PM Sanchez in China

articles.author: Joyce Lee
articles.description: South Korea convened an international summit on Monday seeking to establish a blueprint for the responsible use of artificial intelligence (AI) in the military, though any agreement is not expected to have binding powers to enforce it.
articles.title: South Korea summit to target 'blueprint' for using AI in the military

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The opposition says Edmundo Gonzalez won the July presidential election. Prosecutors issued an arrest warrant for him in connection to the publication of the tallies.
articles.title: Venezuela opposition leader Gonzalez flies to Spain after arrest warrant
